result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:16 AM Defendant MICHAEL J CHRISTNER in court.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for MICHAEL J CHRISTNER.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pending resolution. However, at this time, Attorney Harless enters not guilty pleas on all counts on behalf of the defendant. 
Bond continued.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:07 AM Defendant MICHAEL J CHRISTNER not in court.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for MICHAEL J CHRISTNER.  Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is running 10 minutes for today's hearing. 
To be recalled. 

9:25 AM Defendant MICHAEL J CHRISTNER in court.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for MICHAEL J CHRISTNER.  Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Counsel recently appointed. 
Defendant to apply to Recovery Court in Eau Claire County.
Current cases are to be consolidated into Eau Claire County matters.. 
Waives preliminary hearing in 22CF19 & 22CF151.
Complete booking process. 
Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MICHAEL J CHRISTNER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless appeared by video for MICHAEL J CHRISTNER. 
22CF19 & 22CF151
Warrants quashed.
Review hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:47 AM Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MICHAEL J CHRISTNER not in court.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for MICHAEL J CHRISTNER. 
Counsel recently appointed and has not had contact with defendant.
$500 - adjacent states.

10:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MICHAEL J CHRISTNER not in court.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for MICHAEL J CHRISTNER. 
Representative from Pre-Trial received notification that he would not be attending due to medical condition. 
Preliminary Hearing requested. 
Status scheduled to determine new counsel.
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MICHAEL J CHRISTNER in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for MICHAEL J CHRISTNER. 
Offer received. Working towards resolution. Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MICHAEL J CHRISTNER not in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for MICHAEL J CHRISTNER.

Close to resolution.
Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
BOND COVERS 22CF19 (MODIFIED) & 22CF151 (NEW)
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess anv drug paraphernalia/ any syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs / any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Not to possess.or consume anv alcohol.
Not to go on anv premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No verbal or physical abuse of anyone.
No contact with anv storage units unless its one he has personally rented.
Bond from 22CF19 to be applied to 22CF151.
